verses.roman:
rājā duhitaraṁ prāha
kṛta-pādābhivandanām
āśiṣaś cāprayuñjāno
nātiprīti-manā iva

synonyms: rājā—the King (Śaryāti); duhitaram—unto the daughter; prāha—said; kṛta-pāda-abhivandanām—who had already finished offering respectful obeisances to her father; āśiṣaḥ—blessings upon her; ca—and; aprayuñjānaḥ—without offering to the daughter; na—not; atiprīti-manāḥ—very much pleased; iva—like that.
translation: After receiving obeisances from his daughter, the King, instead of offering blessings to her, appeared very displeased and spoke as follows.
